## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've been playing around with the Verus public testnet, and I was wondering why it only allows converting between two specific currencies, and doesn't support cross-chain conversions?

**AI Assistant:**
I think there might be some misinformation going on! The Verus public testnet actually enables 100% liquid conversion between any currencies, including cross-chain conversions, at any volume. Conversions are fully decentralized and require a standard protocol fee of 0.01%, which goes 100% to miners and stakers of the network. The Verus protocol calculates one price per block for all buys and sells in that block with zero spread. You can try it out and see for yourself!

**User:**
That sounds awesome! But, I've also heard that creating a new blockchain and currency on the Verus public testnet requires permission from the Verus team. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not true! The Verus public testnet is not a centralized system, and anyone can create a new blockchain and currency on it without needing permission from the Verus team. The Verus protocol enables anyone to make new blockchains and currencies, each with scale and operational independence, zk-SNARK privacy, automatic wallet support, and 100% liquid conversion between currencies. You can create your own chain and currency without any restrictions!

**User:**
That's amazing! But, I've also seen that it requires 1 VRSCTEST per block of notarization to make a chain. Is that correct?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not correct! According to the chain definition, a minimum of 0.01 VRSCTEST per block of notarization is required, and VRSCTEST are needed in the wallet to make a chain. So, it's actually much more accessible than you thought!
Can you explain why the Verus public testnet only allows converting between two specific currencies, and doesn't support cross-chain conversions?

The Verus public testnet actually enables 100% liquid conversion between any currencies, including cross-chain conversions, at any volume. Conversions are fully decentralized and require a standard protocol fee of 0.01%, which goes 100% to miners and stakers of the network. The Verus protocol calculates one price per block for all buys and sells in that block with zero spread.

The Verus public testnet enables anyone to make new blockchains and currencies, each with scale and operational independence, zk-SNARK privacy, automatic wallet support, and 100% liquid conversion between VRSCTEST currency at any volume. Sending currencies cross-chain or converting between currencies is as easy as sending a cryptocurrency in less advanced systems today, except that the new Verus protocol enables you to include another blockchain as part of your destination and convert a fractional reserve currency to and from its reserve, according to its exact price along the way. All conversions are fully decentralized, require a standard protocol fee of 0.01%, which goes 100% to miners and stakers of the network, and calculates one price per block for all buys and sells in that block with zero spread.Verus PBaaS Reserve technology enables any organization of any size to make a currency with its own blockchain, support it in world class wallets, develop its own applications, and use it for payments worldwide that can be converted to the reserve currency without ever having to leave the blockchain network. Each blockchain is independent and connected through the Verus Reserve protocol.
# Notable Changes
- Fixed daemon output export error message on VRSCTEST
- Fixed fees bouncing back from a reserve send to Verus and allow exports to continue if done incorrectly
- Include currency state in chain definitions for both getchaindefinition and getdefinedchains# Chain definition:- Maximum of 3 eras
- Minimum 500 blocks worth of notarizations.
- Minimum of 0.01 VRSCTEST per block of notarization.
VRSCTEST are needed in wallet to make a chain.
